summary: Forces trained in explosive ordnance disposal are critical to DOD military operations. From 2002–2012, DOD added more than 70% more of these forces to meet increasing demand. When not deployed, these forces are also used to protect U.S. and foreign dignitaries. From 2007–2017 their use for such “VIP” missions more than doubled. DOD said that routine VIP missions affect these forces’ preparation for deployment. But...
title: Warfighter Support: Actions Needed to Improve Explosive Ordnance Disposal Forces Planning
